function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Limited supply of professional signs due to demand and production capacity","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Lack of follow-up research with customers to assess subjective properties of signs","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Limited data collection due to Covid-19 restrictions","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Need for rapid communication during crises","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Operational changes for retailers to operate under social distancing","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Variation in regulations between geographic locations","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Lack of readily available Covid-19 content and necessary software code for digital signs","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Repurposing equipment as a coping mechanism for retailers","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Lack of alternative contact methods for customers at closed retailers","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Inadequate crisis management planning for small retailers","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Ineffective use of digital signs by multi-location retailers during the pandemic","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Informal signs conveying regret, gratitude, and well-wishes may lead to increased foot traffic and close interactions, posing a risk of contagious disease spread.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Informal signs conveying facts about expected behavior may not encourage compliance with public health guidelines, increasing the risk of contagious disease spread.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Introduction of non-local retail brands and their signage may not align with the neighborhood’s nature, potentially impacting the sense of community and local identity.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Use of informal signs alongside professional signs may lead to confusion and inconsistent messaging regarding social distancing measures.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Continued presence of informal signs may signal a lack of standardized health and safety measures, potentially undermining public confidence in the effectiveness of the retail environment’s disease mitigation efforts.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"The coexistence of informal and professional signs may create confusion and uncertainty for individuals navigating retail environments, leading to potential violations of social distancing guidelines.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Use of small and sans-serif fonts on informal signs","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Limited color options due to cost and availability of printers","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Miscommunication of professionalism and seriousness due to font choice","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Informal signs in retail stores may not effectively communicate social distancing and hygiene measures, leading to increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Inconsistent compliance with government regulations due to lack of resources for smaller retailers, potentially leading to increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Use of paper signage in retail stores may deteriorate quickly due to weather conditions, reducing the effectiveness of communication and hygiene messaging.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Informal signs used to explain the process to customers initially","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Duct tape used for marking direction of travel and indicating where to stand","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Stress reducing comprehension of new information","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Unclear or unreadable signage regarding social distancing measures","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Mix of informal and professional signs","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Longevity of professional signs","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Informal signage and communication strategies in retail environments could lead to ineffective messaging about Covid-19 precautions and symptoms.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Lack of standardized signage in small businesses may result in inconsistent communication of Covid-19 information to the public.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Limited ability of small businesses to develop visually appealing and effective signage may hamper the communication of Covid-19 precautions and symptoms.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Informal signs printed in small font result in visually messy and unorganized presentation of information, increasing cognitive load on consumers.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Use of multiple informal signs and different approaches by retailers can lead to inconsistency and potential confusion among customers.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Handmade signs with haphazard appearance may convey unprofessionalism and lack of attention to detail.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Informal signs with general information initially provided to consumers may not effectively communicate specific social distancing rules","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Customer uncertainty due to unreadable signage and lack of clear information about open services and hours of operation","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Difficulty in accessing digitized information for customers without online access","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Lack of replacement signs for Covid-19 measures communication","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Panic buying leading to stockouts and scarcity of essential goods","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Inadequate communication of stockout reasons to customers","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Informal signs with handwritten and typed messages were used to communicate store closures and operating status.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Perception of short-term closure led to lack of alternative methods of contact provided by small businesses.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Lack of updating information on signs over time during the pandemic.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Informal signs printed on paper with regular tape may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases if not properly handled or disposed.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Frequent changes to signs and their locations create potential confusion and inconsistency in communicating Covid-related information.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Use of traditional paper signs for Covid-related information limits the ability to dynamically update and adapt messaging in real-time.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Rapid spread of Covid-19 in the built environment due to frequent behavioral changes and adjustments by retailers and consumers.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Photographing signs related to Covid-19 inside retail establishments may increase the risk of exposure to the virus for the person taking the photographs.","category":"","confidence":""},{"name":"Frequent visits to grocery stores, pharmacies, and restaurants may increase the risk of exposure to Covid-19 due to potential contact with infected individuals or contaminated surfaces.","category":"","confidence":""}]}
